logicalTable.name: F5 Time Series and Level Based Examples
logicalTable.description:
This logical table contains metrics that always return value at a particular level within a dimension. Eg:- Revenue at Month level, Billed Qtry at Year level, Booked Amt for all Products etc.
All metrics in this table are logical calculations based on physically mapped metrics from F0 Rev Base Measures and F1 Inv Base Measures.

logicalColumns.name: 121  ---- Dynamic Time Level ---------------------
logicalColumns.description:
Help :
Header object, dummy not to be used in any queries

logicalColumns.name: 121  Period Ago Rev
logicalColumns.description:
Help :
Revenue data. Sources from Dollars physical column in FactsRev table joining to time using Billed time.  

- Returns data as of previous month vs. month selected in the query.

expressionObjects: logicalColumn:01 - Sample App.F0 Sales Base Measures.1- Revenue

logicalColumns.name: 122  Rev Var to Period Ago
logicalColumns.description:
Help :
Revenue data. Sources from Dollars physical column in FactsRev table joining to time using Billed time.  

- Value change to last month

logicalColumns.description:

- Quarter Ago Quarter-To-Date Value for the same period. For the same period in the previous quarter, it returns the sum of all the values from the first day of the quarter to that period.

expressionObjects: logicalColumn:01 - Sample App.F5 Time Series and Level Based Examples.135  Qtr To Dt Rev Sum
logicalColumn:01 - Sample App.F5 Time Series and Level Based Examples.136  Qtr Ago QTD Rev sum

logicalColumns.name: 144   ======== Rolling Measures ========
logicalColumns.description:
Help :
Header object, dummy not to be used in any queries

logicalColumns.name: 144  ---- Alias Based Modelling -------
logicalColumns.description:
Help :
Header object, dummy not to be used in any queries

logicalColumns.name: 144  Trailing N Mth Rev  (Alias Based)
logicalColumns.description:
Help :
Revenue data. Sources from Dollars physical column in FactsRev table joining to time using Billed time.  

- Rolling 3 months sum as of selected month : sum of current month plus previous two months value. For January, it gives the value of January plus December and November of the previous year

expressionObjects: logicalColumn:01 - Sample App.F0 Sales Base Measures.117  Unbound Rolling Rev  (Alias Based)
logicalColumn:01 - Sample App.F0 Sales Base Measures.X10  Dim Julian Mth Number
logicalColumn:01 - Sample App.F0 Sales Base Measures.X11  Fact Julian Mth Number
variable:DUAL GENERIC NUM VALUE =3.N_TRAIL_PAST_MTHS

logicalColumns.name: 145  Trailing N Mth Rev Daily Avg
logicalColumns.description:
Help :
Revenue data. Sources from Dollars physical column in FactsRev table joining to time using Billed time.  

- Daily average over Rolling 3 months period : Rolling 3 months sum as of selected month divided by number of days in R3M period.

expressionObjects: logicalColumn:01 - Sample App.F5 Time Series and Level Based Examples.144  Trailing N Mth Rev  (Alias Based)
variable:DUAL GENERIC NUM VALUE =3.N_TRAIL_PAST_MTHS

logicalColumns.name: 146  Trailing N Mth Rev Mthly Avg
logicalColumns.description:
Help :
Revenue data. Sources from Dollars physical column in FactsRev table joining to time using Billed time.  

- Monthly average over Rolling 3 months period : Rolling 3 months sum as of selected month divided by 3

expressionObjects: logicalColumn:01 - Sample App.F5 Time Series and Level Based Examples.144  Trailing N Mth Rev  (Alias Based)
variable:DUAL GENERIC NUM VALUE =3.N_TRAIL_PAST_MTHS

logicalColumns.name: 150   ======== Level Based Measures ========
logicalColumns.description:
Help :
Header object, dummy not to be used in any queries

logicalColumns.name: 150  ---- Time Level Based ---------
logicalColumns.description:
Help :
Header object, dummy not to be used in any queries

logicalColumns.name: 150  Rev  (Full Mth Sum)
logicalColumns.description:
Help :
Revenue data. Sources from Dollars physical column in FactsRev table joining to time using Billed time.  

- Sum of the metric value for the full month. This aggregation is always calculated at the month level.. For example, when viewed against Week level, it shows the same total month's value for all the weeks in that month.

expressionObjects: logicalColumn:01 - Sample App.F0 Sales Base Measures.1- Revenue

logicalColumns.name: 151  Rev  (Full Qtr Sum)
logicalColumns.description:
Help :
Revenue data. Sources from Dollars physical column in FactsRev table joining to time using Billed time.  

- Sum of the metric value for the full quarter. This aggregation is always calculated at the quarter level. When viewed against Month or Week level, it shows the quarter's value for all the weeks and months in that quarter.

expressionObjects: logicalColumn:01 - Sample App.F0 Sales Base Measures.1- Revenue

logicalColumns.name: 152  Rev  (Full Year Sum)
logicalColumns.description:
Help :
Revenue data. Sources from Dollars physical column in FactsRev table joining to time using Billed time.  

- Sum of the metric value for the full year. This aggregation is always calculated at the year level. When viewed against quarter, month or week level, it shows the year's value for all the quarters, month, and weeks in that year.

expressionObjects: logicalColumn:01 - Sample App.F0 Sales Base Measures.1- Revenue

logicalColumns.name: 153  Rev  (Mago Full Mth Sum)
logicalColumns.description:
Help :
Revenue data. Sources from Dollars physical column in FactsRev table joining to time using Billed time.  

- Full month's value of the metric for the previous month. This aggregation is always calculated at the month level. For example, when viewed against Week level, it shows the same total month's value for all the weeks in that month.

expressionObjects: logicalColumn:01 - Sample App.F5 Time Series and Level Based Examples.127  Mth Ago Rev  (Fix Time Lvl)

logicalColumns.name: 154  Rev  (Yago Full Mth Sum)
logicalColumns.description:
Help :
Revenue data. Sources from Dollars physical column in FactsRev table joining to time using Billed time.  

- Full month's value of the metric for the same month in the previous year. This aggregation is always calculated at the year level. For example, when viewed against Week level, it shows the same total month's value for all the weeks in that month.

expressionObjects: logicalColumn:01 - Sample App.F0 Sales Base Measures.1- Revenue
logicalLevel:01 - Sample App.H0 Time.Month

logicalColumns.name: 155  Rev  (Yago Full Year Sum)
logicalColumns.description:
Help :
Revenue data. Sources from Dollars physical column in FactsRev table joining to time using Billed time.  

- Full year's value of the metric for the previous year. This aggregation is always calculated at the year level

expressionObjects: logicalColumn:01 - Sample App.F5 Time Series and Level Based Examples.129  Year Ago Rev  (Fix Time Lvl)

logicalColumns.name: 160  ---- Other Dims Level Based ---------
logicalColumns.description:
Help :
Header object, dummy not to be used in any queries

logicalColumns.name: 160  Rev  (Sum for All Customers)
logicalColumns.description:
Help :
Revenue data. Sources from Dollars physical column in FactsRev table joining to time using Billed time.  

- Sum of the metric for all the Customers. It always returns the value at Total level irrespective of the level within the Customer dimension that is used in the query

expressionObjects: logicalColumn:01 - Sample App.F0 Sales Base Measures.1- Revenue

logicalColumns.name: 161  Rev  (Sum for All Offices)
logicalColumns.description:
Help :
Revenue data. Sources from Dollars physical column in FactsRev table joining to time using Billed time.  

- Sum of the metric for all the Markets. It always returns the value at Total level irrespective of the level within the Market dimension that is used in the query

expressionObjects: logicalColumn:01 - Sample App.F0 Sales Base Measures.1- Revenue

logicalColumns.name: 162  Rev  (Sum for All Products)
logicalColumns.description:
Help :
Revenue data. Sources from Dollars physical column in FactsRev table joining to time using Billed time.  

- Sum of the metric for all the Products. It always returns the value at Total level irrespective of the level within the Product dimension that is used in the query

expressionObjects: logicalColumn:01 - Sample App.F0 Sales Base Measures.1- Revenue

logicalColumns.name: 163  Rev  (Sum for All Employees)
logicalColumns.description:
Help :
Revenue data. Sources from Dollars physical column in FactsRev table joining to time using Billed time.  

- Sum of the metric for all the Employees. It always returns the value at Total level irrespective of the level within the Employee dimension that is used in the query

expressionObjects: logicalColumn:01 - Sample App.F0 Sales Base Measures.1- Revenue

logicalColumns.name: 164  Rev  (Sum for All Orders)
logicalColumns.description:
Help :
Revenue data. Sources from Dollars physical column in FactsRev table joining to time using Billed time.  

- Sum of the metric for all the Customers. It always returns the value at Total level irrespective of the level within the Customer dimension that is used in the query

expressionObjects: logicalColumn:01 - Sample App.F0 Sales Base Measures.1- Revenue

logicalColumns.name: 165  Rev  (Sum for All Dims But Time)
logicalColumns.description:
Help :
Revenue data. Sources from Dollars physical column in FactsRev table joining to time using Billed time.  

- Sum of the metric for all the dimensions except Time. It always the value at the Total level when viewed against all the dimensions except time.  When viewed against Time, it returns the value at that level.

expressionObjects: logicalColumn:01 - Sample App.F0 Sales Base Measures.1- Revenue

logicalColumns.name: 954  ---- Time Spans Var---------------------
logicalColumns.description:
Help :
Header object, dummy not to be used in any queries

logicalColumns.name: 954  FTE Headcount  (Value Var)
logicalColumns.description:
Help :
Revenue data. Sources from Dollars physical column in FactsRev table joining to time using Billed time.  

- For any time interval specified in the query row, this aggregation returns the difference between value at beginning of the interval and value at end of the interval. The values at beginning and end date that make up the variation can be displayed by adding aggregation objects Fst oT and Last oT. Info about beginning date and end date for each row are available with time facts objects : First Time Day Dt and Last Time Day Dt. For example, if a query is filtered for a quarter, this will show the value variation between first and last day of the quarter. If the query objects are at week level, This aggregation will returns for each row (week level) the value of the last day of each week minus value of the first day in that week.

expressionObjects: logicalColumn:01 - Sample App.F4 Headcount Base Measures.9- Full Time Empl  (End Period)
logicalColumn:01 - Sample App.F4 Headcount Base Measures.9- Full Time Empl  (Beg Period)

logicalColumns.name: 955  FTE Headcount  (Pct Var)
logicalColumns.description:
Help :
Revenue data. Sources from Dollars physical column in FactsRev table joining to time using Billed time.  

- This aggregation converts the Value Var aggregation metric into a percentage variation to first value (Value Var / initial value *100)

expressionObjects: logicalColumn:01 - Sample App.F4 Headcount Base Measures.9- Full Time Empl  (End Period)
logicalColumn:01 - Sample App.F4 Headcount Base Measures.9- Full Time Empl  (Beg Period)

logicalColumns.name: 956  FTE Headcount  (Cmpd Yrly Gwth)
logicalColumns.description:
Help :
Revenue data. Sources from Dollars physical column in FactsRev table joining to time using Billed time.  

- For any time interval specified in the query row, this aggregation returns the difference between value at beginning of the interval and value at end of the interval. The values at beginning and end date that make up the variation can be displayed by adding aggregation objects Fst oT and Last oT. Info about beginning date and end date for each row are available with time facts objects : First Time Day Dt and Last Time Day Dt. For example, if a query is filtered for a quarter, this will show the value variation between first and last day of the quarter. If the query objects are at week level, This aggregation will returns for each row (week level) the value of the last day of each week minus value of the first day in that week.

expressionObjects: logicalColumn:01 - Sample App.F4 Headcount Base Measures.9- Full Time Empl  (End Period)
logicalColumn:01 - Sample App.F4 Headcount Base Measures.9- Full Time Empl  (Beg Period)
logicalColumn:01 - Sample App.F90 Time Facts.T64  # of Months

logicalLevels.name: Day Detail
preferredDrillPath: 01 - Sample App.H4 Offices and Channels (M:M).Off and Chnl Detail

logicalHierarchies.name: H0 Time [branch at level 'Month']
logicalHierarchies.description:
Time Dimension : 
Type - Time. 
Includes two drill paths: Fiscal Year and Year. 
Both the paths include levels Year->Half->Qtr->Month->Week->Day

logicalHierarchies.name: H0 Time [branch at level 'Fiscal Month']
logicalHierarchies.description:
Time Dimension : 
Type - Time. 
Includes two drill paths: Fiscal Year and Year. 
Both the paths include levels Year->Half->Qtr->Month->Week->Day
